job_description: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - job post Intone Networks 15 reviews Frisco, TX Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Contract We are currently seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Frisco, TX. Job Description: Performs complex data research and analysis to support business and technology operations. This job involves developing data mining and data analysis methodologies and creating algorithms and predictive models, while also performing custom statistical reporting and analysis based on organization need. Along with the creation of new models, there will also be the need to internalize, understand, support, and maintain models created by other internal or external teams. The job will potentially review the modelling work of others and will partner with other team members and other teams to implement new models and methodologies as needed. You will collaborate with a team of other Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Data Analysts to build, implement, and maintain new models. Key Responsibilities and Duties: Understand and participate in the end-to-end Client Operations life cycle Work with product owners, peers, and leadership to establish objectives for Client/AI efforts Develop and implement data mining protocols, architectures, and models as well as data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets. Assess accuracy of model performance, accuracy of statistical reporting, interpretation of data to generate insights, and create data visualizations to better understand client relationships and improve client services and product offerings. Communicate insights from analysis to management in order to enable data driven decision making to improve business performance and operational outcomes based on machine learning and statistical analysis results. Research and stay up to date on existing and emerging innovations related to machine learning Maintain models, assess degradation, and retrain or implement changes to improve model performance over time Document all steps within the modelling and development processes In all facets, being a problem solver whether it's a technical issue, a process problem, or helping with a business problem Identify areas of opportunity and risk related to our data, models, and our unique business problems Become a subject matter expert and collaborate with other stakeholders to enhance offerings. Document learnings and establish a training and mentoring routine for junior team members. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree Required; Master's Degree Preferred 3-Years Required; 5-years Preferred Proficiency with Python and associated data science libraries Experience in data modeling and schema design SQL experience and command of query design and optimization Knowledge of different types of databases (e.g. relational, document, key/value) as well as experience with particular implementations and cloud versions such as Snowflake Machine learning background with an understanding of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning methods, reinforcement learning, deep learning, Bayesian inference, graphical modeling, or nonlinear/stochastic optimization Experience in deployment and maintenance of models in a production environment Ability to collaborate with technical and business teams to identify specific business opportunities and use data to support decision making. Ability to work within a fast-paced environment with quickly changing priorities. Work independently or on a team. Ability to exercise judgment as it relates to business decisions and their effects on stakeholders. Critical thinking skills. Must be a fast learner and willing to learn independently The right candidate for this job is a problem solver who can also consult with business partners to solve business problems with their expertise and tools at hand Preferred Qualifications: Data science and machine learning platforms like SageMaker, Domino Data Lab Client models using Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow Experience building & deploying Client products over GCP and/or AWS Financial Industry background Customer Experience and Customer Journey models

Sr. DevOps (AWS) Engineer - job post AccelPad Dallas, TX • Remote Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Contract AccelPad is seeking a Senior AWS DevOps Engineer to manage teams that will build and maintain solutions both on-premise and in AWS. If you have a solid knowledge on fundamental networking and strong Java development experience, this will be a perfect opportunity to grow your professional career. This is a 100% remote opportunity. Responsibilities Participate in the design and development of a cloud-based ML Learning platform and services Assist in building out the DevOps strategy for hosting and managing our microservice and connector infrastructure in AWS cloud Good track record of working with Java and distributed computing platforms in large enterprises where scale and complexity have been tackled Proven experience participating in agile development projects for enterprise-level systems component design and implementation Deep understanding and application of enterprise software design for implementation of data services and middleware. Good working knowledge of DevOps tools like Jenkins, Jira, Ansible, Terraform, CFT, etc Hands-on with CICD pipeline, Terraform, AWS EKS, Python, Shell scripting, and Linux. Proficient in building Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CD), and Continuous Deployment pipelines using different DevOps tools. Experience in Infrastructure build and testing Automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation on AWS Familiarity interacting with AWS API. Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 8 plus years of experience in designing, building, and deploying secure, scalable, highly available applications in cloud environments. 5+ years of provisioning, operating, and managing AWS environments. An AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional and certified in at least one of these: Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), Docker Certified Associate (DCA), Puppet Certified Professional, DevOps Engineer Expert. Experienced engineer with hands on and good coding skills, preferably with Java, Python AWS Cloud experience – Proficient in container orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, AWS ECS, and AWS EKS. EMR, S3, EFS, MSK, etc. Experience with Hadoop and various data formats like Parquet, CSV, etc. Knowledge and experience with Containerized Micro Services Hands-on experience with Kubernetes, Helm, GitOps Great attention to details with analytical/curious mind Organizational and communication skills Experience with machine learning a plus. "U.S. Citizens, Green Card holders and those authorized to work in the U.S. who do not need a Visa Sponsorship are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor or hire H1B at this time" Send me your resume directly to Chris.Castilla@accelpad.com
